title: Robust magnetic energy harvesting with flexible lead-free poly(vinylidene fluoride)-Ba0.85Ca0.15Ti0.9Zr0.1O3 fibers and Metglas-based magnetoelectric composites
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D3SE01517C, Paper
J. Kaarthik, Nayak Ram, Radhamanohar Aepuru, Salla Gangi Reddy, Durga Prasad Pabba, Annapureddy Venkateswarlu
The article explores flexible materials merging BCZT–PVDF microfibers and Metglas for generating electricity from magnetic fields. They exhibit high MME voltage coefficient (472.1 V cm−1 Oe−1) and produce 14.8 V open-circuit voltage at 10 Oe AC, 50 Hz, translating to 4.7 µW cm−3 power density.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
